intro: Hieracium punctilloides, commonly known as the dotted hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a distinctive white or pale yellow center. Hieracium punctilloides is an annual or biennial plant that produces numerous seeds, contributing to its widespread distribution.
